intro: Nothoscordum gramineum, commonly known as the grassy garlic. It is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is often grown as an ornamental plant. Nothoscordum gramineum is known for its mild garlic scent and is sometimes used in herbal remedies.
